name: Embassy Suites San Diego - La Jolla

reviews.text: I've ready the other reviews. I'll be back. Clean, quiet, easy access to several freeways. The only downside are the too-low-wattage
reviews.title: I'll stay there again.

likes.disliked: — needs brighter lighting for extended reading

reviews.text: compact fluorescent bulbs. It just wasn't bright enough for my 55-year-old eyes.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are regular ES customers, but the first time at this property. Easy, courteous check-in with ample garage parking minus the $17 a day fee.
reviews.title: Attentive, courteous, beautiful!

reviews.text: The King room had large flat panel in living room, but the room was slightly smaller than most other ES we stayed and it lacked the wetbar feature, but stiil had a granite top sink, fridge and micro.
reviews.title: Awesome stay at the Embassy Suites

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, very clean rooms and common areas, free breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bedroom was very clean, and had a down comforter. The TV was not a flat panel, but who comes to such a beautiful city to watch tv in the room?
reviews.title: Excellent Emabassy Suites

reviews.text: This hotel is in an excellent location just outside the village of La Jolla between two of the major freeways (but far enough away from them that it is quiet). You can get to all popular San Diego area attractions very easily and quickly. A large upscale shopping centre, Westfield UTC, is directly across the street. Rooms are typically Embassy Suites ... fairly large and comfortable. This property has recently been updated and has flat screen TVs and some nicer, modern furniture. The only downsides ... windows do not open and the air conditioner unit in our room was rather noisy. Pool was nice. Breakfast was also decent with a nice outdoor eating area. All in all, a very good hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: Great Location, Very Good Hotel

reviews.text: This was a great place to stay overall but I was met with some unexpected surprises. Parking at $17/night was the most disconcerting. I found one clerk unhelpful on two occasions but a second was both helpful and accommodating. After all is said and done this was a great place and the made to order breakfast definitely added value to our stay (probably just enough to offset the $17 nightly parking fee.
reviews.title: Great place except for customer service

reviews.text: The billing had to be corrected for overcharges twice. We were charged for tv channels that we did not view. The free channels are not even worth watching.
reviews.title: Billing surprises

likes.disliked: — Overcharges- It seem you have to watch your wallet with them. Parking

reviews.text: Everyone is charged $17.00 each night for parking. I had to prove that I did not park on the property for this charge to be removed. The parking is very tight and my friend had alot of trouble with his truck.
reviews.title: Better value to be found

reviews.text: The rooms are nice but for the inconviniences, it was not worth the money that was paid.
reviews.title: We Loved the Embassy

reviews.text: Having read reviews of just about every hotel in San Diego, we finally decided on The Embassy due to location, price and the fact it had been newly refurbished.
reviews.title: Weekday dream - weekend nightmare

likes.disliked: — Noisy kids at weekends, poor service in restaurant

reviews.text: The rooms were beautifully decorated and very spacious. Breakfast was the usual hot buffet, but it was plentiful and the evening receptions were lovely. Parking was a problem as the spaces in the car park were small and it was often full.
reviews.title: Great Stay for Parents AND Kids!!

reviews.text: We were very happy with the location, and the staff were very helpful. In fact, our stay from Wednesday to Friday was brilliant, but come Friday night, it turned into a kids playground with the arrival of teams for a water polo competition.
reviews.title: Made trip with a toddler a great success!

reviews.text: Now I do not blame the hotel, I blame the parents. What are parents thinking allowing their kids to run wild all over the hotel? On more than one occasion we had the kids knocking on our room door, riding the lifts from floor to floor and then running all the way around the hotel shouting. Do parents have no consideration for other people or can they just not be bothered to take control of their kids? The weekend spoiled what would have otherwise been a brilliant hotel and we will definitely stay there again if its during the week!
reviews.title: Great Place for Families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed in Embassy Suite La Jolla with wife and 2 kids in early June 2008. What a treat! Hotel was clean, quiet, updated and conveniently located for our visits to San Diego and sites to the north. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Bedroom and suite were large enough for the four of us to spread out and be comfortable without crowding. Bathroom was clean and large as well. Public areas (lounge, pool, lobby) were also inviting and comfortable. Free hot breakfast buffet and manager's reception daily were awesome and only added to the great value and experience.
reviews.title: Great for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: excellent room, big, clean and very confortable.
reviews.title: great staying

reviews.text: good breakfast included.
reviews.title: Overall good

likes.liked: — Good location in La Jolla, great value, nice suites, good free breakfast

reviews.text: complimentary drink every afternoon. good business center.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel

reviews.text: US$17 parking fee.
reviews.title: La Jolla ES is a more upscale facility than other ES's, but less personable.

likes.liked: — Upscale facility, modern decor and furniture
likes.disliked: — Additional parking fee. Less personable staff.

reviews.text: Good location....far from the beach , but very accesible to all main san diego attractions.
reviews.title: Two bad apple's can spoil the whole barrel

likes.liked: — Nothing now, I was totally insulted

aka: Embassy Suites San Diego - La Jolla Hotel San Diego
description: A full service, all suite property in the heart of La Jolla's Golden Triangle. All suites,lobby, atrium and restaurant have been completely remodeled. A full,hot breakfast and evening cocktails are served complimentary for all hotel guests daily; and Indulge Restaurant offers Happy Hour Specials Monday through Thursday in a contemporary but comfortable atmosphere. Shopping and Dining available within walking distance and Diego's main attractions and beaches are just a short drive away.
